title: Amazon plans to use AI to speed up TV and film production
description: Amazon plans to use artificial intelligence to speed up the process ​for making movies and TV shows even as Hollywood fears that AI will ‌cut jobs
content:
Amazon plans to use artificial intelligence to speed up the process ​for making movies and TV shows even as Hollywood fears that AI will ‌cut jobs and permanently reshape the industry.

title: The AI Crossroads: How Artificial Intelligence Could Stall, Slow, or Surge by 2030
description: The OECD finds that AI’s path to 2030 is highly uncertain, ranging from a plateau at today’s capabilities to rapid advances that could match or exceed human performance. Because all scenarios remain plausible, policymakers must prepare for uncertainty rather than betting on a single AI future.
content: Artificial intelligence is advancing so quickly that even its leading architects are unsure where it will stand by the end of this decade. A major new OECD study, developed by the organisation’s Strategic Foresight Unit and AI policy teams in collabo... [4511 chars]

title: Finland and the AI Shift: Why Most Workers Will Gain, but One in Five Faces Job Risk
description: Finland is among the world’s best-prepared countries for artificial intelligence, with strong digital skills and rapid adoption helping many workers, especially in education, healthcare, and professional services benefit from AI. However, about one-fifth of the workforce, particularly in highly exposed administrative and technical roles, faces a real risk of job displacement as AI use accelerates.
content: Artificial intelligence is no longer a general idea in Finland, it is already shaping how people work, learn, and deliver public services. According to a new analysis by the International Monetary Fund, drawing on research from institutions such as t... [4326 chars]

title: Promising green solutions lying dormant in labs to get $40 million push to market
description: A $30 million Artificial Intelligence Centre of Excellence for the Built Environment was also announced. Read more at straitstimes.com.
content:
SINGAPORE – A $40 million fund has been launched to push promising climate and sustainability innovations out of the lab and into the market.

title: 40 Global Experts Join UN's AI Panel: IIT Madras Professor Among Appointees
description: IIT Madras Professor Balaraman Ravindran joins 39 others on a UN-appointed expert panel to guide the global discourse on Artificial Intelligence. The panel aims to bridge AI knowledge gaps and impact assessments, paving the way for cooperative solutions in technology amid geopolitical and technological challenges.
content: In a landmark decision, the United Nations has nominated a global consortium of 40 distinguished experts, including Professor Balaraman Ravindran from IIT Madras, to a new scientific panel focused on Artificial Intelligence. This initiative, led by U... [738 chars]

title: How the AI boom could push up the price of your next PC
description: The global race for artificial intelligence is causing a surge in demand and prices for memory chips. This is affecting the cost of high-end computers and may soon impact everyday electronics like smartphones. Chip manufacturers are prioritizing AI data centers, leading to slower production and higher costs for consumer-grade components.
content:

title: Explained - Why Nvidia, Broadcom shares rose after Alphabet's capex announcement
description: Alphabet is one of several technology firms ramping up capital expenditure as they expand data center capacity to support artificial intelligence workloads.
content: Unlike many peers that rely heavily on industry-standard Nvidia processors, much of Google’s AI software runs on its in-house TPUs. The company’s latest flagship model, Gemini 3, was trained using these proprietary chips. Broadcom works with Google o... [2560 chars]

title: Texas DPS plans to increase surveillance over next 5 years
description: The plan largely involves the use of artificial intelligence tools, drones, flock cameras and other technology to react to crimes as fast as possible — in some cases, before they even happen.
content:
The Texas Department of Public Safety has released their five-year plan for homeland security in the state, largely focusing on surveillance, prediction and preemptive law enforcement.

title: Software selloff continues as investors debate AI's existential threat
description: The recent downturn in global software stocks has investors on edge, pondering whether the fears surrounding artificial intelligence have been blown out of proportion. As new AI applications begin to reshape the industry, legacy software businesses are bracing for potential upheaval.
